@angersson I am not sure why you say that this is not a bug. The issue is that tf.gradients is returning a None value inside of a tf.while_loop, but not when called with the exact same variables outside of the loop:

import tensorflow as tf

i = tf.constant(0)
a = tf.constant(3.0)
b = tf.constant(5.0)
print("External gradient:", tf.gradients(a, a)[0])     # Prints Tensor("gradients/Fill:0", shape=(), dtype=float32)

def loop_body(i, a, b):
    print("internal gradient:", tf.gradients(b, a)[0]) # Prints None
    return i + 1, b,  b ** 2

tf.while_loop( lambda i,a,b: tf.less(i, 5), loop_body, [i, a, b]);
body:
@angersson I am not sure why you say that this is not a bug. The issue is that tf.gradients is returning a None value inside of a tf.while_loop, but not when called with the exact same variables outside of the loop:

```
import tensorflow as tf

i = tf.constant(0)
a = tf.constant(3.0)
b = tf.constant(5.0)
print("External gradient:", tf.gradients(a, a)[0])     # Prints Tensor("gradients/Fill:0", shape=(), dtype=float32)

def loop_body(i, a, b):
    print("internal gradient:", tf.gradients(b, a)[0]) # Prints None
    return i + 1, b,  b ** 2

tf.while_loop( lambda i,a,b: tf.less(i, 5), loop_body, [i, a, b]);
```
